meanings.definition: The act of beginning again after a pause or interruption.
meanings.sent1: After the break, the resumption of the class was welcomed by the students.
meanings.sent2: The resumption of the game after halftime brought excitement to the fans.
meanings.sent3: The resumption of the party after the power outage made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The resumption of the music filled the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The resumption of the rain made the garden come alive with freshness.

meanings.definition: The act of taking back possession or control.
meanings.sent1: The resumption of the stolen item by the police was a relief for the owner.
meanings.sent2: The resumption of authority by the leader restored order in the community.
meanings.sent3: The resumption of the lost toy by the child was a moment of triumph.
meanings.sent4: The resumption of the remote control from the toddler saved the TV from chaos.
meanings.sent5: The resumption of the stolen car by the police was a victory against crime.
